name: 11.9 "Feelings...Whoa, Whoa, Whoa" Online Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who did Cliff think moved next door to him?
questions.explanation:
Adolf Hitler.

	He said the man was "a little guy, about 100 years old". He also said he had "a thick German accent, a little mustache and liked to paint".

questions.text: How much did Hill charge Sam's customers for all-you-can-eat mackerel that may or may not have gone bad?
questions.explanation:
$2.

	He told them if it was bad they could expect anything from nausea to death. The men decided it was worth the risk.

questions.text: Who agreed that Cliff might be right in his thinking?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	Everyone else was saying how Cliff might have gone over the edge. Woody suspected that Cliff was listening, so he said maybe Hitler was alive and living in Cliff's apartment.

John Hill.

	Norm told everyone because he was up at Melville's looking for another fish fry. Rebecca said that it was horrible.

questions.text: What did Rebecca say made you a good person?
questions.correct: Pretending to be nice to someone
questions.explanation:
Pretending to be nice to someone.

	Rebecca had a strange value system. Sam called the hospital and found out Hill was in stable condition.

questions.text: Who told Carla about the person who had a heart attack?
questions.explanation:
Frasier.

	They thought Carla didn't know because she came into work. Not only did she know, she was there when it happened.

questions.text: Carla said she had no feelings for the man who had a heart attack. What did she do that proved she did have feelings for him?
questions.explanation:
Started crying.

	She said, "My boyfriend is in the hospital". She confessed to Sam that she told Hill she loved him.

questions.text: Who kept Cliff from being evicted?
questions.explanation:
Ma Clavin.

	His landlord said she made a stirring speech in Cliff's defense. He was going to be kicked out because of his obsession with the man he thought was Hitler.

questions.text: Who visited the man who had a heart attack in the hospital?
questions.explanation:
Carla.

	She wanted to make it clear to Hill that she didn't care for him, because she did care for him. She was afraid if he thought she cared for him, he would leave her.

questions.text: How long did the doctors say the man who had a heart attack had to remain celibate?
questions.explanation:
8 weeks.

	Carla was shocked by that news. Hill suggested perhaps they take their relationship to the next level.
